case_vignette: A 60-year-old female presents with an intermittently tender spot on the left ear present for six months. She denies any trauma to the area but notes she often lays on the left side when sleeping at night. She denies any history of skin cancer. Examination reveals a crusted light pink papule along the left superior helix along the cartilaginous component. A biopsy is performed and reveals an ulcer with underlying dermal fibrosis with adjacent granulation tissue.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a sore spot on my left ear that has been bothering me on and off for about six months.
Have you noticed any changes in the appearance of the sore spot?
Yes, it has a crusty light pink bump on it.
Do you have any history of skin conditions or allergies?
No, I don't have any history of skin cancer or allergies that I'm aware of.
Do you have a family history of any skin conditions or skin cancer?
I haven't mentioned anything about my family's medical history, so I can't say.
Got it. Have you taken any medications or received any treatment for this sore spot?
No, I haven't taken any medications or received treatment for it.
Understood. Have you experienced any pain or itching in the sore spot?
The spot is tender but I didn't say it was painful or itchy.
I see, my apologies for assuming. Are there any other symptoms associated with the sore spot on your left ear?
No, there are no other symptoms that I've mentioned.

I appreciate your patience. Based on your symptoms and history, I suspect you may be dealing with a condition known as basal cell carcinoma. I recommend you see a dermatologist for further evaluation and treatment.

**Final Diagnosis:** Basal Cell Carcinoma
